name: Chinese Chicken Wings
author: Jeanette Boisvert
summary: My late mother's recipe for chicken wings for potlucks. Now I am asked to bring this dish to parties.
ingredients: 5 pounds chicken wings, split and tips discarded
directions: Stir the soy sauce, brown sugar, and garlic powder together in a saucepan over medium heat; cook and stir until the sugar melts completely
Remove from heat and allow to cool
Place the chicken wings in a large bowl
Pour the soy sauce mixture over the wings and toss to coat evenly
Cover the bowl with plastic wrap
Allow chicken to marinate in refrigerator overnight or 8 hours
Preheat an oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
Pour the chicken wings and marinade into a 9x13-inch baking dish
Cover the baking dish with aluminum foil
Bake in the preheated oven until thoroughly hot, about 45 minutes
Remove the aluminum foil from the baking dish and continue baking uncovered another 15 minutes
